ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: The benefit of this course is that it brings together all the new doctoral students. It isn't about learning a lot; it's about meeting people, discussing interesting papers and talks, and getting started on being a PhD student.
I declined to enter workload, because workload for this class is really what you make of it.

I wish the class would have focused more on all the aspects of working through a PhD at Yale and given us a better idea of what to expect over the course of our time here, rather than focusing so much on the weekly lectures, which were kind of hit or miss.

I believe this is a very important class for the first year Phd students in order to transition students into the PhD and most importantly get started on the reasearch (the earlier the better). I found the quality of the FES pewsentations mixed and some not really appropriate to the seminar. I would hope for more scientific presentations and less applied work for this class as we focus on our research. I would suggest to structure the class more in terms of research methods and break down the assignment into small parts with several deadlines.
Getting to know other doctoral students, sharing concerns, and reading / discussing interesting articles
Getting my butt in gear on formulating my research.
In-class discussion with students and presenters.
Opportunity to work and receive feedback on my research and the chance to meet and interact with other PhD students at FES.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: I think it was sometimes unclear what was expected out of the final project / report.
Nothing, It worked great as is.

The quality of FES presentations were mixed. I don't think the class need to be attached to the Wednesday FES presentations. I don't think some presentations were relevant to research work. There are plenty of great researched at FES and YALE to maintain the idea of including many speakers in the class but fosing more on the research process.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: They were always available.
Both Dave and Mary were extremely helpful and supportive.
Very good.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: It fits greats, helpful to first semester doctoral students to get going and understand the program better.
Very important class for the first year of PhD to start developing my research.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Required
required. but I am glad I did.
Required.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Exceeded.
Yes, very much so!
Somewhat, see first question.
I was expecting a little more of a research methods class with more structure, but the cours was helpfull and is very important.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: More.
Yes, it was very helpful.
Yes. I got the opportunity to get started on my research, get some feedback and get to know the othe PhD students.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take advantage of this class to advance your research project and ger as much feedback as possible.
